Action.author: scottz
Action.body: ~dongming : Does PTE print a log when a transaction event is received which is a duplicate? Or print a log if it is unknown? If it is easy to get those logs, then that is probably the easiest way to debug this to identify the extra transaction. We say this problem with OTE too, but very rarely, and we would have to implement something very similar to how PTE catalogs and checks off events from a complete list. We will probably also need to turn up and examine all the orderer logs and maybe the kafka logs... but let's try to get some info from the PTE first.

Action.author: dongming
Action.body: ~scottz PTE listens to every event port associated with every peer that the tx is sent to. For example, if the same tx is sent to two peers, then PTE will receive two event for the same tx. When PTE receives an event, PTE will delete it from the list. If the event does not exist in the list, PTE just silents.

Action.author: dongming
Action.body: Executed FAB-3832-4i.sh and FAB-3833-2i.sh on vLaunch two time each and cannot reproduce the error of one extra transaction.

Action.author: denyeart
Action.body: ~dongming ~scottz Ok, I will return the defect, please re-open if you can reproduce in the future.
